title: PCT 29: An Assiniboine war-party is stopped by evil portents
author: Chihtchikwayow

sentences.english: Minakos is the name of him whose story I am going to tell.
This is what he told.

sentences.original: mitâtaht nîsosâp nâpêwak wawêyîwak, ê-wîh-nitopayicik, opwâsimôwak, ayâhciyiniwah ê-wîh-ntopayistawâcik.
sentences.text: mitâtaht nîsosâp nâpêwak wawêyîwak ê-wî-nitopayicik opwâsîmôwak ayahciyiniwa ê-wî-nitopayîstawâcik
sentences.english: Twelve men made ready to go on the war-path, Assiniboine, to make war on the Blackfoot.
Accordingly they set out.
When they had gone a long way, at one time they saw a storm coming;
unceasingly the Thunderers were coming with repeated noise.
When the storm came near, they made a shelter.
They stayed in one place, fixing their guns upright in the ground;
over them they hung their blankets;
they stayed underneath there.

sentences.original: asê-takosinomakaniyiw, yêkaw pisisik êkotowahk ohcih kâ-kimiwaniyik.
sentences.text: asê-takosinomakaniyiw yêkaw pisisik êkotowahk ohci kâ-kimiwaniyik
sentences.english: It came backwards; a downpour of sand was the rain.
sentences.footnote: LB on {asê-takosinomakaniyiw}:  The sandstorm is viewed as though the Thunderers were presenting themselves backwards; hence solid rain instead of liquid.

sentences.english: Then they arose; they set out again.
Then they saw another thing coming.
Again they sat down.
The storm overtook them.

sentences.original: apisîs wâh-wâyawis nipiy pahkihtiniyiw, êkwah pisisik kinosêwah êkotôwahk ôhcih nayêstaw êh-kimiwahk.
sentences.text: apisîs wâh-wâyawis nipiy pahkihtiniyiw êkwa pisisik kinosêwa êkotôwahk ohci nayêstaw ê-kimiwahk
sentences.english: A few scattered drops fell, for this was a rain of fishes and of nothing else.

sentences.original: omayikohk êtokê ispapiwak, êkosi, pêyak misit.
sentences.text: ômayikohk êtokê ispapiwak êkosi pêyak misit
sentences.english: So deep they lay on the ground, like this, a foot deep.
Then they arose; they went on.
Presently they saw a buffalo;
it was very long since they had eaten.
One youth was told, “Go kill it; let us eat, when you have killed it.”
Accordingly he went.
He killed it with a shot; he brought them to that place.
They skinned it, taking the hide entire.
Then they cut it open and drew out the entrails.

sentences.original: êkotah itâmihk, ôtê otêhihk ana mostos, kî-pêh-otiskawapiw kisêyiniw, mitonih êh-wâpistikwâtit, êh-pêyakwaniyik oskîsik, êh-tapahtâskwêpit.
sentences.text: êkota itâmihk ôtê otêhihk ana mostos kî-pê-itiskwêpiw kisêyiniw mitoni ê-wâpistikwâtit ê-pêyakwaniyik oskîsik ê-tapahtâskwêpit
sentences.english: Inside there, by the heart of that buffalo there sat facing them an old man with white hair and only one eye, his head bowed forward.
They were frightened.
“Perhaps we shall not fare well.
Never has such a thing happened.”
They left it there; they did not eat it.
They went from that place.

sentences.original: êkosi kîtahtawêh mostos-mêskanaw êko mitimêwak, k-âti-mâh-mîsiyit êsah mostoswah.
sentences.text: êkosi kîtahtawê mostoso-mêskanaw êkwa mitimêwak kâ-ati-mâh-mîsiyit êsa mostoswa
sentences.english: Then soon they followed the trail of the buffalo, where  these had left their tracks.
Suddenly the fat in the heart-bladder grew hot.
They were frightened at seeing this astounding thing.
They did not take it with them, but left it.
Then, as they marched along, the weather grew hot;
they became thirsty.
They could not find any water.

sentences.original: êkwah atimwah pêyak wîcêwêwak, omaskisiniwâwah êh-otâpêyit;
sentences.text: êkwa atimwa pêyak wîcêwêwak omaskisiniwâwa ê-otâpêyit
sentences.english: They had a dog with them to carry their moccasins;
this dog left the trail in its thirst.
Soon when they looked, it had drunk.
“Why, the dog has drunk; he has found water.
Perhaps it is over with our thirst.
Run down there; go and see,” the leader told a young man.
He ran thither;
the dog came running;
it reeled over, falling from what it had drunk.
The young man called out; “Whiskey!” he said.
Then all ran to the place.
When they smelled it, really it was whiskey.
They would not drink;
they were afraid of it.
“Never has the like of this happened.
Perhaps we shall not fare well.
We had better go home,” said he who had made the war-party.
So they came home.

sentences.original: ana wiyah atim kîh-kawipêw : êyiko pikoh ê-kîh-minihkwêt, osâm ê-nôhtêyâpâkwêt.
sentences.text: ana wiya atim kî-kawipêw êwako piko ê-kî-minihkwêt osâm ê-nôhtêyâpâkwêt
sentences.english: As for the dog, it died of what it had drunk, it alone having drunk in its thirst.
That is all.
